thread.title: Jurgen Klopp hails Liverpool victory over League Two Plymouth as "very important"
thread.title_full: Jurgen Klopp hails Liverpool victory over League Two Plymouth as "very important"

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Jurgen Klopp hails Liverpool victory over League Two Plymouth as "very important"
text:
Jurgen Klopp hails Liverpool victory over League Two Plymouth as "very important" Brazilian Lucas scored the only goal of the game - his first for seven years Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Jurgen Klopp speaks after 1-0 win over Plymouth Share this video Get Liverpool FC   Could   
Watch Jurgen Klopp 's Plymouth vs Liverpool post-match interview in the video above. 
The Reds progressed into the FA Cup fourth round thanks to Lucas's first half header. It was the Brazilian's first goal for seven years. 
But it wasn't all one way traffic. The League Two side had their fair share of chances and went close through Jervis's spectacular effort which hit the post. 
Liverpool did have a chance to double their lead when they were awarded a penalty, but Divock Origi's dreadful effort was easily saved. Klopp speaks after the Plymouth game (Photo: BT Sport) 
Speaking to BT Sport after the game, Klopp said: "The longer you don't score the more exciting it can get and you saw that when they started getting really direct, we are not used to it and they hadn't played too often together - the back-line. 
"Okay, they had a few chances but so did we, especially in the last 20 minutes where we controlled the game. Lucas Leiva scores the opening goal (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty) 
"Maybe it wasn't the most exciting game but for us it's very important as...it's another game for a few of the young boys, so that's all good." 
Liverpool will take on Wolves at Anfield in the FA Cup fourth round. 
BT Sport is your home of unmissable live football from the Premier League, UEFA Champions League, UEFA Europa League and FA Cup. Visit btsport.com for more info. poll loading Will Liverpool win a trophy this season? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
